column4: people, what's the time? Since we installed feisty, both of our computer clocks went nutts!!!
1122 GMT, i've had some fun with system clocks during installs =)
are you sure?
yep, 1223 BST where i am
ok now I feel better
hehe good stuff, the problem i had was that my system clock was too far out for ntpdate to sync it for me, so i just had to do it manually once
I did it manually for my bf but he told me it went crazy again the next day
and I already thought that I am crazy and lost 5 hours
does he dual-boot?
with windows i mean..
yes
but I think he wasn't booting in win these days
it has something to do with it?

that'll probably be it, windows handles time in a more primitive way than linux, always insists on the hardware clock being at local time, whereas linux keeps the hardware clock at UTC and just deals with it
5 hours?
although linux can (has to so windows doesn't fuck it over) do both
depends where you live
and the time of year, i found it a bit of a nightmare to wrap my brain around what was going on =)
but I think it also might be the battery in his case
i'd say that's unlikely if your clock's out by ~exactly 5 hours, which i'd imagine it is
he is not at home now and i don't remember if it was 5 hours exactly
